title: Ensure worktree isolation works with handoff workflow
description:
Verify that worktree features work correctly with agent-human handoff:

Scenarios to verify:
1. Agent hands off task → worktree should be preserved (not deleted)
2. Human provides feedback → agent resumes in same worktree
3. Multiple handoffs on same task → worktree state maintained
4. Epic completion with handoffs → proper cleanup

Key considerations:
- Worktree is per-epic, not per-task
- Handoffs within same epic should use same worktree
- Only cleanup worktree when epic is fully done

Test cases:
```go
func TestWorktreePreservedOnHandoff(t *testing.T) {
    // 1. Start epic in worktree
    // 2. Agent signals APPROVAL_NEEDED
    // 3. Verify worktree still exists
    // 4. Simulate human approval
    // 5. Agent continues in same worktree
}
```

Acceptance criteria:
- [ ] Worktree not deleted on handoff signals
- [ ] Same worktree used after human response
- [ ] Worktree cleaned up only on epic completion
- [ ] Parallel handoffs to different epics isolated
